my_list = [i for i in range(5)]
m = [my_list[i] for i in range(4, 0, -1) if my_list[i] % 2 != 0] print(m)

questions.question_text:
Assuming that the following code has been executed successfully, select the expressions which evaluate to True (Choose two.)
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: AD
Correct Answers
A. If invoking open() fails, an exception is raised
D. open() is a function which returns an object that represents a physical file

A second parameter is not necessary because it uses default parameters. See the documentation:

https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#open

If the mode is not specified, it defaults to 'r'.

Therefore, the correct answers are A and D.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true? (Choose two.)

choices.A: if invoking open() fails, an exception is raised
choices.B: instd, outstd, errstd are the names of pre-opened streams
choices.D: open() is a function which returns an object that represents a physical file

discussion.content:
Only option C, `random.choice([1,2,3]) > 0` will return TRUE.
All other options are FALSE.

Selected Answer: C
import random
v1 = random.random()
v2 = random.random()
print(v1 ==v2) #False
print(v1>1) # False
print(random.choice(([1,2,3],1))>0) # True

Option C is correct 
Explanation:
import random 
v1 = random.random() 
v2 = random.random()
random.choice([1,2,3]) > 0` will return TRUE.

All others options will return output as FALSE.

questions.question_text: Assuming that the code below has been executed successfully, which of the following expressions will always evaluate to True? (Choose two.) import random v1 = random.random() v2 = random.random()

What is the expected output of the following code if there is no file named non_existing_file inside the working directory?
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The first number is not "1" because the try block raises an exception before it reaches the print function. The last number is "2" because of the except block and, additionally, the else block not being executed.
